intro: Maba quiloensis, commonly known as the Ethiopian maba, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its woody stem, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. It produces berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
